Description: Stamp (vessel): quarter-qisṭ. Eight line Kufic inscription. Fragment of rim attached. Made of green glass.
Curator's comments: In the second line ‘fā' alif ‘of ‘al-wafāʾ’ has been omitted, doubtless by haplography since the ‘wāw alif’ of ‘wa amara’ that follows it looks very similar. The digit of the date is invisible but all Dā’ūd's pieces with legible dates are of the same year. Though a quarter-qisṭ in his name has not been published before the qisṭ and half- qisṭ are known (Launois 1957, 85; Balog 1976, 204). Bibliography: Launois, Aimée. 1957. Estampilles et poids faibles en verre Omeyyades et Abbasides au Musée Arabe du Caire, ‘Mélanges islamologiques’ III; Balog, P. 1976. ‘Ummayad, ʿAbbasid and Ṭūlūnid glass weights and vessel-stamps’. New York.
Bibliographic references: Morton 1985 / A Catalogue of Early Islamic Glass Stamps (99)
Associated names: Named in inscription: Dā’ūd b. al-Murr
